intro: Erigeron vicinus, commonly known as the small fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, roadsides, and disturbed areas. It produces small, white to pale yellow ray flowers surrounded by numerous disk flowers. Erigeron vicinus is often found in the eastern and central United States, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soils.
